body.p: This is the reference manual for Liquid Site version .
This chapter contains introductory information about Liquid Site and attempts to explain the basic concepts needed for later chapters.

item.text: A little bit of history and reasoning behind Liquid Site. Also outlines the major advantages to using a content management system (CMS) and Liquid Site in particular.
Summary of the most important terminology used throughout this reference manual.
An introduction to the administration application that is used for managing everything in Liquid Site.

body.p: This chapter explains how to create and design web sites in Liquid Site. It details how sites and pages work, the processing flow, and how to create dynamic web sites. If you only write content for web sites, you can skip ahead to the next chapter.

item.text: Explains how web sites are created, structured and matched to requests.
Details how to create web sites, pages, templates and other objects in the site view. This chapter also explains the basic request processing.
Detailed description of the request processing flow.

body.p: This chapter explains how to create and design web content in Liquid Site. It details how sections and documents are structured, the tagged text format, and how objects can link to each other.

item.text: Describes how sections work and how web content is structured and arranged in hierarchies.

body.p: This chapter explains the basic security and workflow aspects of Liquid Site. It details how users and groups are managed, publishing workflows, and how to secure web sites.

item.text: Details of the authentication and authorization process.
